identity.name: PolarizadosYA!
identity.description: A mobile-first management system for automotive tinting and technical services. The design bridges the gap between a rugged workshop environment and a sleek, modern SaaS interface.

headings.usage: Page titles, Section headers, KPI values

body.usage: General text, form labels, data tables

mono.usage: License plates, VIN numbers, Order IDs

grid_system.mobile: Single column stack with bottom sheet navigation

buttons.primary: bg-brand-primary text-black font-bold hover:bg-brand-secondary transition-all shadow-[0_0_15px_rgba(41,182,246,0.3)]

inputs.style: bg-black/20 border-white/10 focus:border-brand-primary focus:ring-1 focus:ring-brand-primary h-12 text-base

visual_enhancers.tracing_beam: Use for active service cards to indicate 'Work in Progress'
visual_enhancers.noise_texture: Subtle grain overlay on dashboard background to reduce digital flatness

motion.page_transition: initial={{ opacity: 0, y: 20 }} animate={{ opacity: 1, y: 0 }} exit={{ opacity: 0, y: -20 }} transition={{ duration: 0.3 }}

assets.icons: Lucide React (default) or Phosphor Icons (for technical depth)

accessibility.contrast: Ensure 4.5:1 ratio for text. Use 'text-white' on brand backgrounds.
accessibility.touch_targets: Minimum 44px height for all interactive elements (Mobile First rule).

instructions_to_main_agent: Implement a 'ThemeToggle' component but default to Dark Mode for the initial impression.
Use 'Barlow Condensed' for all headings to give that 'Garage/Industrial' feel.
For the '360 Inspection', create a visual component where users can tap on parts of a car silhouette (SVG) to add damage notes.
The 'Kanban' board on mobile should be a horizontal swipeable list of columns, not a squeezed grid.
Use the 'Tracing Beam' effect on the 'En Proceso' (In Progress) cards in the dashboard to highlight active work.
Ensure all forms (Ingreso, Cotizaci√≥n) are broken down into steps (Wizard pattern) on mobile to avoid scrolling fatigue.
Add 'data-testid' to all buttons, inputs, and cards.
universal_guidelines: Do not use generic gradients. Use solid colors or subtle noise textures.
Avoid 'Inter' font for headings. Use the specified 'Barlow Condensed'.
Ensure 2-3x more spacing than typical designs. Don't cram content.
Use glassmorphism for sticky headers and floating action buttons.
Never use pure black (#000000) for backgrounds. Use #0a0a0a or #171717.
